meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: How To Be Schizophrenic -- And Successful

div.div: Thirty years ago, I was given a diagnosis of schizophrenia. My prognosis was “grave”: I would never live independently, hold a job, find a loving partner, get married. Today I am a chaired professor at the University of Southern California Gould School of Law.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y4z4Nh&via=Digg&text=How To Be Schizophrenic -- And Successful

div.a: You Will Not Stop Watching Vinepeek

div.div: You might not be sold on Twitter's new short video app Vine, but we challenge you to try and stop watching Vinepeek. You won't. You'll be stuck for 20 minutes before mustering the will power to look away.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VeO0WV&via=Digg&text=You Will Not Stop Watching Vinepeek

div.a: Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen Might Be Getting A Sex Change

div.div: Over the past several days, a rumor, based on both still photos and IMDb credits for Zack Snyder's upcoming Superman movie Man of Steel, has spread throughout the nerdosphere: that Snyder's made an important change to the Superman canon, turning Superman's pal, cub reporter Jimmy Olsen, into a girl.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W8AGGo&via=Digg&text=Superman's Pal Jimmy Olsen Might Be Getting A Sex Change

div.a: The Short, Strange Life Of An Original Viral Star

div.div: Aleksey Vayner was one of YouTube's first celebrities. But the life that followed was no "impossible" dream.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VcqKc0&via=Digg&text=The Short, Strange Life Of An Original Viral Star

div.a: When The Law Won't Call It Rape

div.div: If there's confusion among the public (and politicians) about rape, baffling, conflicting state laws make it worse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WZRqhb&via=Digg&text=When The Law Won't Call It Rape

div.a: LeBron James Tackles Heat Fan Who Hits $75,000 Shot

div.div: Check out this highlight of one lucky Heat fan who throws up a one-handed hook shot from half court and sinks it for 75,000 dollars, much to the delight of everyone in the arena, especially LeBron James, who storms the court and tackles him!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14lfPT2&via=Digg&text=LeBron James Tackles Heat Fan Who Hits $75,000 Shot

div.div: If you look at the Sun (which you shouldn’t, ever), you just see white light. And there is a lot we can learn about the Sun by viewing it in that range, from studying its undulating surface swirls to its rotation. But scientists at places like NASA can learn even more by extending their “eyes” beyond the visible.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WWEHvV&via=Digg&text=The Colors Of The Sun

div.div: Hacktivist group Anonymous took over the United States Sentencing Service's website earlier today to announce its intention to expose government secrets in response to the US Department of Justice's treatment of Aaron Swartz.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V995nl&via=Digg&text=Anonymous Declares 'War' On U.S. Government

div.a: This Is What It Looks Like When You Defrost An Entire Building

div.div: Have you ever wondered what happened when a company abandons a warehouse that used to house ten stories of cold storage?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14gZFew&via=Digg&text=This Is What It Looks Like When You Defrost An Entire Building

div.div: LIKE RECORDING OVER OLD VHS TAPES

div.a: Secret Painting In Rembrandt Masterpiece Revealed

div.div: Scientists may be one step closer to revealing a hidden portrait behind a 380-year-old Rembrandt painting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10Q5R8I&via=Digg&text=Secret Painting In Rembrandt Masterpiece Revealed

div.div: If you thought driving on Earth is a chore, you haven't tried off-roading on another planet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V1iNbk&via=Digg&text=Distances Driven On Other Worlds

div.div: A class action suit about Facebook's Sponsored Stories feature resulted in a $20 million settlement. Up to $10 of that money might be coming to you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tzsxwp&via=Digg&text=Facebook Might Owe You $10

div.a: This Tiny Pet Quadcopter Could Be Your Own Personal Cameraman

div.div: A new, tiny quadcopter called the MeCam is just begging to be your ever-present cameraman. And you best take it up on the offer, there's no way you could find a human that willing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10X3nKy&via=Digg&text=This Tiny Pet Quadcopter Could Be Your Own Personal Cameraman

div.a: The Crazy Economics Of Mining Asteroids For Gold And Platinum

div.div: Not one but two companies have now decided that they’re going to mine asteroids to collect gold and platinum.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W9687m&via=Digg&text=The Crazy Economics Of Mining Asteroids For Gold And Platinum

div.a: Shroud Of Cold Air Descends On The U.S.

div.div: We just want to pass along this video from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, which shows how the cold air spread from last Saturday (Jan. 19) through Thursday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVez4D&via=Digg&text=Shroud Of Cold Air Descends On The U.S.

div.div: Everyone’s favorite superhero mayor rescued a dog named Cha Cha from the cold Thursday night, proving once again why he’s just the best at saving things.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ur6eqR&via=Digg&text=10 Things Cory Booker Has Saved

div.div: Like armies everywhere, the German military is filled with macho, chest-thumping rituals. But one battalion has found there's a downside to all that chest-thumping: The male soldiers are growing breasts — and only on their left sides.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10OR4Lq&via=Digg&text=Male Soldiers Are Growing Breasts

div.div: WANTED LEONARDO DICAPRIO TO PLAY HIM

div.a: Julian Assange Slams Leaked WikiLeaks Movie Script

div.div: If you're making a movie about WikiLeaks, this is the kind of thing you should probably have seen coming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WYL8hO&via=Digg&text=Julian Assange Slams Leaked WikiLeaks Movie Script

div.a: Behold The Cat Bomb, The 16th Century's Fuzziest Weapon

div.div: This page from a 1584 treatise on explosive weaponry reveals two of the 16th century's more mobile methods of destruction: the cat bomb and the bird bomb, apparently used to set buildings on fire.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10YnA3k&via=Digg&text=Behold The Cat Bomb, The 16th Century's Fuzziest Weapon

div.a: While 'jOBS' Fawns Over Subject, Film Falls Flat

div.div: The eagerly awaited biopic of the Apple founder aims to capture a legend, but neglects the world he lived in.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TADq1d&via=Digg&text=While 'jOBS' Fawns Over Subject, Film Falls Flat

div.div: The Syrian regime is arming and training Syrian women to fight for President Bashar al-Assad, putting it out in front of the Pentagon when it comes to sending women to the front lines.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TxHaQY&via=Digg&text=The All-Female Militias Of Syria

div.a: Exclusive New Texts From Scientology’s L. Ron Hubbard

div.div: The greatest affiliation of Hubbard’s life—his first, last, and longest professional connection—wasn’t Scientology or even Dianetics. It was the Explorers Club of New York City, the preeminent society of adventurer-scholars.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10G2WiE&via=Digg&text=Exclusive New Texts From Scientology’s L. Ron Hubbard

div.a: Instagram Now Asking For Your Government Issued Photo IDs

div.div: Over the past week, a number of users of the popular photo sharing app Instagram have been locked out of their accounts and prompted by both services to upload images of their government issued photo IDs to regain access.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VnNqLV&via=Digg&text=Instagram Now Asking For Your Government Issued Photo IDs

div.div: WON'T GO NEAR THE GOWANUS, THOUGH

div.a: Dolphins Form Life Raft To Help Dying Friend

div.div: Everybody's favorite cetacean just got a little more lovable. For the first time, dolphins have been spotted teaming up to try to rescue an injured group member.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14hkXaU&via=Digg&text=Dolphins Form Life Raft To Help Dying Friend

div.a: Twitter's Speech Problem: Hashtags And Hate

div.div: On October 19, 2012, Twitter turned censor. In response to complaints from the Union of French Jewish Students, Twitter pulled tweets that used the hashtag #UnBonJuif, or “a good Jew,” which had been worked into slurs and jokes, some using concentration-camp photographs as illustrations.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Urrm00&via=Digg&text=Twitter's Speech Problem: Hashtags And Hate

div.div: As Ethan Nadelmann, Executive Director of the Drug Policy Alliance tells Big Think, marijuana occupies a special status in American culture and our legal system. This status is based on the belief that this substance is far more dangerous than any scientific evidence has borne out.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WY3cbS&via=Digg&text=The Catch-22 Of Marijuana Research

div.a: Color-Blind Man Is Now A Cyborg Who Can Hear Color

div.div: When Neil Harbisson was a kid, he could only see in black and white. In fact, he wasn't totally convinced that colors actually existed. But now, Harbisson can sense color.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y3Zajv&via=Digg&text=Color-Blind Man Is Now A Cyborg Who Can Hear Color

div.div: WE THOUGHT THE MAIL NEVER STOPS

div.a: Do We Really Want To Live Without The Post Office?

div.div: The postal service is not a federal agency. It does not cost taxpayers a dollar. It loses money only because Congress mandates that it do so. What it is is a miracle of high technology and human touch. It's what binds us together as a country.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10olSCG&via=Digg&text=Do We Really Want To Live Without The Post Office?

div.a: American Girls With Their American Girls

div.div: For more than two years, Ilona Szwarc has traveled across the country and photographed roughly 100 girls.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WzWBVe&via=Digg&text=American Girls With Their American Girls

div.div: Eels, desert ants, and shorebirds are among the most impressive, expert says.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WVST8n&via=Digg&text=5 Amazing Animal Navigators

div.div: It doesn't want Twitter to see who your Facebook friends are.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XFo0nK&via=Digg&text=Why Facebook Snipped Twitter's Vine

div.a: Internet Connection Crucial To Everyday Life, German Federal Court Rules

div.div: Because an internet connection is an important commodity, the plaintiff should be compensated for the loss of it, the court ruled.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VaQVje&via=Digg&text=Internet Connection Crucial To Everyday Life, German Federal Court Rules

div.div: YOUR PARENTS REALLY DO STRESS YOU OUT

div.a: Stress's Impact Can Affect Future Generations' Genes

div.div: For the first time, genes chemically silenced by stress during life have been shown to remain silenced in eggs and sperm, allowing the effect to be passed down to the next generation.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14dpUSV&via=Digg&text=Stress's Impact Can Affect Future Generations' Genes
